messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/CommentController.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\CommentController@destroy` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Full path
- /v1/comments/{comment}

All methods allowed?
- No

Methods:
- HEAD: No
- POST: No
- OPTIONS: No
- TRACE: No
- GET: No
- PUT: No
- DELETE: Yes
- PATCH: No

Explanation
- In routes/api.php there is a Route::prefix('v1')->group(...). Inside the authenticated middleware group the file registers Route::apiResource('comments', CommentController::class)->only('destroy');. The apiResource destroy action corresponds to a DELETE route for the resource item, i.e. DELETE /comments/{comment}, and the prefix('v1') makes the full path /v1/comments/{comment}.
- No route definition in the provided files registers any other HTTP method (GET/POST/PUT/PATCH/HEAD/OPTIONS/TRACE) for this endpoint, so only DELETE is acceptable based on the code. The "all methods" override is not present.
- The determination is strictly from the route definitions in the code (and the mapping of resource action "destroy" to DELETE /resource/{resource}); no runtime/framework assumptions (such as implicit HEAD/OPTIONS handling) were used.
